definition: be high up in the sky
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat

sentences.english: Punting is an important part of the game.
sentences.chinese: 踢凌空球是那項比賽的一個重要部分。

sentences.english: The sky was blue, the larks was soaring high over the green corn.
sentences.chinese: 長天一片澄藍，碧綠的莊稼上雲雀凌空穿飛。

sentences.english: At least we now know what constitutes a volley.
sentences.chinese: 至少現在我們知道了什麼能構成一次凌空抽射。

sentences.english: He has even started to score volleys with his left foot.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至開始左腳凌空射門得分。

sentences.english: An extra half-hour was spent with the Frenchman volleying crosses from either side.
sentences.chinese: 他又進行了半小時的邊路傳中之後凌空射門的訓練。

sentences.english: Floating down the rain down, there is green dill growing in air.
sentences.chinese: 順着雨絲飄下的，還有凌空生長的綠蘿。

sentences.english: The ledge overhangs by several feet.
Bebeto volleyed the ball 30 metres away from the net.
sentences.chinese: 貝貝託在距球門30米開外凌空抽射。

sentences.english: From a high hill in the sky, just like a drencher hoisted the air.
sentences.chinese: 從高高的山頭凌空下，宛如一幅水簾懸掛空中。

sentences.english: Eer volley crane wings, red people dauntless.
sentences.chinese: 俄而白鶴展翅凌空，沖人霄漢。

sentences.english: I ascend, I float in the regions of your love O man.
sentences.chinese: 我凌空飛昇，我飄拂在你那愛的疆域，啊，男人。

sentences.english: If you stretch out a greedy hand to it, it will fly high away like a red-crowned crane.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向它伸出貪婪的手，它就會像仙鶴凌空飛去。

sentences.english: He kicks a foot out over the abyss, balancing on one of his tree-trunk legs.
sentences.chinese: 他朝着深淵凌空踢出一腿，用一條腿保持平衡。

definition: to soar/to rise high into the air
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to dive down fast/to swoop down
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
